titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Richard E. Shope papers, Rockefeller University Faculty FA199

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-03-07 00:25:46 -0500.

did.unittitle: Richard E. Shope papers, Rockefeller University Faculty

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Richard Edwin Shope; 1901-1966, physician and researcher in the field of virology at The Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research, first in the Department of Animal Pathology at Princeton and later at the laboratories in New York City. He discovered the cause of swine influenza and anticipated a similar observation in humans; he identified the "mad itch" virus (disease in Midwestern cattle). He discovered two virus tumors of rabbits, one a fibroma and the other a papiloma which progresses to cancer. During the World War II he directed the work with rinderpest virus leading to development of a vaccine against this disease in cattle. His last work was in epidemiology and he worked with the natural history of three animal diseases and two virus diseases in deer.

eventgrp.event: Instructor, pharmacology and materia medica, State University of Iowa College of Medicine
Assistant Department of Animal Pathology Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research, Princeton
Member and Professor Rockefeller Institute and Rockefeller University, New York City
October 2 Died James Ewing Hospital, New York City.
Director, War Disease Control Station, Grosse Ile, Province of Quebec. Worked on rinderpest leading to development of an effective vaccine.
Pacific area member of Naval Medical Research Unit #2 to go ashore and appraise medical hazards for troops ashore.
Sc. D. State University of Iowa
John Phillips Memorial Medal American College of Physicians
John Scott Medal and Award, City of Philadelphia
Certificate of Accomplishment, State University of Iowa
Commendation. Department of Conservation and Economic Development State of New Jersey
Special Commendation. U.S. Department of HEW
Kober Medal. Association of American Physicians
New York Academy of Medicine Medal

bioghist.p: Member: National Academy of Sciences, American Philosophical Society, Association of American Physicians, Society for Experimental Pathology, Society for Experimental Biology and Medicine, Harvey Society, Sigma Xi, American Public Health Association, United States Livestock Sanitary Association, American Epidemiological Society, American Academy of Arts and Sciences.

Honorary Member: Eastern Iowa Veterinary Association, American Veterinary Medical Association, New York Pathological Soc., Royal Society of Medicine, Great Britain, Central New Jersey Veterinary Medical Association, American Board of Veterinary Public Health (Honorary Fellow)

Served on: Board of Scientific advisors - Jane Coffine Childs Fund for Medical Research, Scientific advisors, Merck Institute, Aftosa Technical Advisory Group, Pan American Sanitary Bureau, Zoonoses Technical Advisory Group, Pan American Sanitary Bureau, Board of Scientific Consultants, Sloan-Kettering Institute, Research Advisor Council, American Cancer Society, Vaccine Committee, National Foundation for Infantile Paralysis, Committee on Naval Medical Research NRC, Board of Scientific Advisors, Jackson Memorial Laboratory, New Jersey Public Health Council, Chief, Biological Defense, New Jersey Civil Defense Agency, Panel on Animald, Committee on Biological Warfare, Research and Development Board, Department of National Defense, Consultant, Foot and Mouth Disease Research. Secretary of Agriculture, Technical Advisory Committee, New Jersey Civil Defense, Virus and Rickettsial Study Section, U.S. Public Health Service, Advisory Committee on Animal Diseases Transmissible to Man, New Jersey State Department of Health, Advisory Committee Berg Institute of Scientific Service, New York University, Cancer Advisory Board, Bureau of Biological Research, Rutgers University, Committee on Exotic Animal Diseases, USLA, Chairman, Advisory committee on Research on Etiology of Cancer American Cancer Society, Director, Commission on Epidemiological Survey, Armed Forces Epidemiological Board, Consultant to Surgeon General of Navy, Committee on Nationwide Eradication of Hog Cholera, USLSA, Scientific Advisory Committee, Grayson Foundation, Panel Chemical and Biological Warfare, President's Science Advisory Committee, Scientific Advisory Board, Walter Reed Army Institute of Research, Technical Advisory Panel, Biological and Chemical Warfare Secretary of Defense, Panel on Viruses and Cancer, National Advisory Cancer Council, Biological and Chemical Defense Planning Board, Chairman Research Advisory Council, American Cancer Society, Armed Forces Epidemiological Board, Consultant, Executive Office of the President - Special Projects, Commission on Epidemiological Survey, Armed Forces Epidemiological Board, Plum Island Animal Disease Lab - U.S. Department Agriculture Advisory Committee, Lobund Advisory Board, Notre Dame University, Technical Committee on Poliomyelitis Vaccine U.S. Public Health Service, Board of Medical Education and Research, University of Penn. (also Association Trustee), Science Advisory Committee, National Better Business Bureau, The National Foundation, Committee on Virus Vaccines, Consultant Illinois Zoonoses Research Center, Chairman, Section of Pathology and Microbiology NAS, Board of Scientific Counselors, National Cancer Institute, Committee on Science and Public Policy, NAS, NAS/NRC advisory committee on Foot and Mouth Disease, Scientific Advisory Committee, New England Regional Primate Research Center.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, biographical correspondence, photographs, administrative correspondence, bibliography, collected reprints.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted pending permission from Rockefeller University.
